originalText.text: Terrible. Went there twice and I have been denied access to my police report and been told things like â€œ We are too busy here dealing with important matters â€œ as if what happened  to me didnâ€™t matter. Should this be the attitude of the people That are supposed to help us. I needed a copy of my police report and it is a time sensitive matter. This is insane. Why do I pay taxes for, to be denied my rights ?

originalText.text: Police department always helpful no matter what they work hard, but some ppl think they donâ€™t do nothing common everywhere you need to be patient. I love it and yea here my son wants to be a police officer when he grow up. I will support him Inshallahâ€¦

originalText.text: Last week I was taken here after being in a domestic assault with my lovely wife,  Joanne. The police were very rude. They did not believe my story of having no clue what my insane wife was talking about. Could you ever believe she thinks I'm cheating. Anyways, the view was beautiful from the back of the police cruiser. Never knew how beautiful New York is. My service could of been better!

originalText.text: Gave me a ticket for no stopping or standing, even though the sign permits it during Sunday's. Went to go see if any other car had it on their shield, turns out I was the only one. The whole block, on both sides, had no tickets. I wonder why, specifically my car with a Palestinian flag, was targeted. Isn't that weird. HmmmðŸ¤” Looks the cops are good for one thing, and one thing only: clicking their pens.

originalText.text: All I can say is the men and women who serve this great country of ours. In this case of what happend in Manhattan, York. You guys are phenomenal. I pray God blesses all of you and your family, and loved ones. May he watch over all of you, and keep you safe and healthy. Just know how much all the men and women who serve are loved, and valued. May God bless you, your city, your state, and May God bless this Great Country of ours; The United States of America ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸!
